page.title: 17St.Joseph's Convent,Boughton
page.content: Some children from Forest View Junior School, Ollerton visited the above convent in June, 1985. They were met by Sister Mary, who is in charge. She said that the convent was 25 years old, having previously been the Manor House.Sister Mary enjoyed living in{Boughton, mainly because of the surrounding countryside and the peace and quiet. Next,she took the group around the convent, showing them the visitors' room and dining room. In the latter was a huge table, from which the nuns eat, and a wall tapestry showing the crucifixion. The next room was the pantry, where two meat hooks still hung from the ceiling. After showing the group the all-yellow prayer room it was time to go.As a farewell gift Sister Mary gave each child a choc-ice. By D.Toms.
